item.title: Compile help
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“georgedragsnes, post:53, topic:439114”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=541813.msg3969657#msg3969657 date=1334025697]

please replace “java” with what i had said in my last post.
(You may need to edit the path)

You want me to delete all the stuff after the java aswell on the batch and replace with “C://Program Files/java/jre7/bin/java.exe” ?

no, just the word ‘java’. keep everything else.
[/quote]

thank you very much mate, its all working now, and also a huge thanks to randQm aswell[/quote]
k, great

item.title: Compile help
item.dc:creator: @georgedragsnes georgedragsnes
item.description:
@georgedragsnes wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:48, topic:439114”][quote author=georgedragsnes link=topic=541813.msg3969621#msg3969621 date=1334024500]

go for the last one on the list.

still doesnt work… its back to the way it first was lol, only this time the server wont even run

Delete everything java on your computer.

Then download JDK7 and JRE7.

Recompile and run the server. It WILL work if you do this correctly, i don’t see why it wouldn’t.

and if it doesnt, go on teamviewer with me and help me that way??

And promote spoonfeeding? No thanks.

If you cant install JAVA, i dont see how you can program a server…

i know how to install java… no need for your snide comment, no need to be a dick about it mate

I do have a point though, if people depend on having other people do things, and never learn for themselves, we will get nowhere as a community.

On Topic: are you linking to ./program files (x86)/ or just ./program files/ ?

Okay! complier works, but now when i run, it says “the system cannot find the path specified”
[/quote]
put the full java path in quotes. Something like:
“C://Program Files/java/jre7/bin/java.exe”

But the one for you.[/quote]

now it wont let me turn the server online, its saying the " ‘java’ is not recognized as a internal or external command, operable program or batch file

heres the whats it says and the batch

kbevlc.png797×547

Read full topic

But the one for you.

then download the newest JRE

item.title: Compile help
item.dc:creator: @georgedragsnes georgedragsnes
item.description:
@georgedragsnes wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:35, topic:439114”][quote author=georgedragsnes link=topic=541813.msg3969440#msg3969440 date=1334018249]

It’s working, you compiled successfully
the notes, are like it says notes and not errors, so you don’t have to pay attention to them.

when i try to run the server it doesnt work lol…

If the cmd quickly closes, put at the end of the batch “pause” without quotes (if there’s “exit” delete that and replace by pause) and post a screenshot of what it says.
if the problem is something else, tell me what

its has pause at the end of the batch, and it still closes right away when i click run

the client runs fine when i dont change the batch to “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java
but i want to change the name of the client, and it wont compile

when i changed the batch to “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_03\bin\javac.exe” *.java it compiles fine but it doesnt run server

Can you post the code of your run batch

oh wait, it said exit, i changed it to pause this is what comes up now


[/quote]

Update your JRE version to, and recompile afterwards[/quote]

I’ve clicked to download latest JRE and its came up to reinstall lol… i recompiled and tried to run again and its came up the same shit

Heres the Runs batch!

nf2l8l.png795×222

Read full topic
